intro: Eragrostis reptans, commonly known as匍匐早熟禾, is a low-growing grass species native to temperate regions of Asia. It features fine, tufted blades that often lie flat on the ground, forming dense mats. The plant has slender, wiry stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in lawns, meadows, and along roadsides. Its adaptability makes it a common weed in cultivated areas.
